title: Charles Pinckney National Historic Site: Eating & Sleeping
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Eating & Sleeping             Eating & Sleeping      EatingA picnic facility is located near the parking lot at Charles Pinckney National Historic Site. Visitors are encouraged to bring a picnic. Several restaurants are located within a short drive along Long Point Road or U.S. Highway 17. Got Water?This park is a climate friendly site committed to helping decrease greenhouse gas emissions. When you refill a reusable water bottle, you decrease the greenhouse gas emissions associated with the production, filling, packaging, and transport of disposable water containers. Please carry a reusable water bottle and keep plastic out of landfills. A water filling station located near the outdoor restrooms and picnic pavilion provides free, refreshing, filtered water. Fill up and enjoy!        Rangers Michelle and MarQuis enjoy a picnic NPS        Sleeping For information on where to stay while visiting the Charleston area, please contact the Charleston Area Convention and Visitors Bureau.
